flawed_nl_solution:
If Alex has 4 pens in the first week of a month, she will have 4*2 = <<4*2=8>>8 pens in the second week.
After her pen collection doubles in the third week, Alex will have 2*8 = <<2*8=16>>16 pens.
In the last week of the month, Alex will have 2*16 = <<2*16=23>>23 pens after her pen collection.
If Jane has 16 pens after a month, Alex will have 23-16 = <<23-16=7>>7 more pens than Jane.
#### 7

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
